programme.title: The U.S. East Coast
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The U.S. East Coast, The City and the Sea
programme.desc: The journey up the coast continues through Delaware to suburban New Jersey, and onwards into the heart of Manhattan. In Delaware, famous as a corporate tax haven, we visit a winery. In New York City we zip around with a bicycle courier and then head out to Long Island for oysters.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E13 Wildlife Nannies: Baby Badgers
programme.desc: Two badgers keep their nanny busy. They must get used to the wilderness and the sounds of other wild animals.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E14 Wildlife Nannies: Baby Gibbon Kim
programme.desc: Baby Gibbon Kim broke her arm and is recovering, but the arm has to heal fully before she can join her family.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E15 Wildlife Nannies: Animals of Aiderbichl
programme.desc: A day with the animals of Aiderbichl, Salzburg, where badly-treated animal are rescued and shown a happy life.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E16 Wildlife Nannies: Seal Pups in Danger
programme.desc: Storms at the North Sea cause many seal pups lose their families. One nanny is on a mission to rescue a pup.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E17 Wildlife Nannies: Mustang Zibby, the "Zorse"
programme.desc: Mustang Zibby is a “zorse“, half zebra half horse. Can she be trained and find her place in the mustang herd?

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E18 Wildlife Nannies: Wild Arc Canada
programme.desc: Wild Arc is a 24/7 animal ER taking in injured animals from all over Vancouver island - a really tough job.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E19 Wildlife Nannies: Eagles, Owls and Hawks
programme.desc: There are eagles, owls and hawks that need individual care at Fawn Wildlife Haven Rehab, Odessa.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E20 Wildlife Nannies: Baby Alarm!
programme.desc: Baby alarm at Wildpark Daun: Monkeys, emus, and a little lamb are all brought into the world.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E21 Wildlife Nannies: 25 Orphaned Opossums
programme.desc: A San Diego resident Pam Norman shares her home with her husband, her two dogs and 25 orphaned opossums.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E22 Wildlife Nannies: Grizzly Bears
programme.desc: Grizzly Bears are one of the feature attractions of Grouse Mountain Refuge for Endangered Wildlife, Vancouver.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E23 Wildlife Nannies: Best of the Babies
programme.desc: This Best Of episode is a countdown from 10 to 6 of heartwarming stories from the Wildlife Nannies.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E24 Wildlife Nannies: The Rest of the Best
programme.desc: With more than 22 episodes, Wildlife Nannies has shot over 50 stories all over the world. From Salzburg to the beautiful Florida coast, from the breathtaking Canadian wilderness to Berlin – there were many heartwarming stories. This episode is a countdown of the ten stories that touched us the most. Best Of 5 to 1!

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Wildlife Nannies: 2 Baby Raccoons
programme.desc: Two baby raccoons saved from a front yard are in need of special care at Raccoons Bush Wildlife Sanctuary.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Wildlife Nannies: Spa Day
programme.desc: A spa day of back scrubbing, massage and more for the manatees of Homosassa Springs Wildlife State Park.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Wildlife Nannies: Abandoned Fawn
programme.desc: An abandoned fawn is found in woods.and is brought to Fawn Wildlife Rescue Station with a broken leg.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Wildlife Nannies: Orphaned Seals
programme.desc: Along the rugged coast of Aquarium, Vancouver there are orphaned and injured seals that need help.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Wildlife Nannies: Bat Nanny
programme.desc: Will a bat nanny help a bat fledgling learn how to fly and be released back into the night skies?

programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 Wildlife Nannies: Albino Coati Biene
programme.desc: Albino coati Biene moves to a bigger enclosure and meets her new buddies, two raccoons. Will they get along?

programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 Wildlife Nannies: Marmoset Family

programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 Wildlife Nannies: Little Opossum

programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 Wildlife Nannies: Wild Boar Piglet

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E11 Wildlife Nannies: Hungry Baby Squirrels
programme.desc: Two hungry baby squirrels arrive at the Silicon Valley‘s Squirrel Wildlife Center, they are fed every 2 hours.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E12 Wildlife Nannies: Shetland Foal Hanna
programme.desc: The vet checks on Shetland foal Hanna, her nanny is really concerned about a wound from surgery. Will it heal?

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E13 Wildlife Nannies: Baby Badgers
programme.desc: Two badgers keep their nanny busy. They must get used to the wilderness and the sounds of other wild animals.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E14 Wildlife Nannies: Baby Gibbon Kim
programme.desc: Baby Gibbon Kim broke her arm and is recovering, but the arm has to heal fully before she can join her family.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E15 Wildlife Nannies: Animals of Aiderbichl
programme.desc: A day with the animals of Aiderbichl, Salzburg, where badly-treated animal are rescued and shown a happy life.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E16 Wildlife Nannies: Seal Pups in Danger
programme.desc: Storms at the North Sea cause many seal pups lose their families. One nanny is on a mission to rescue a pup.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E17 Wildlife Nannies: Mustang Zibby, the "Zorse"
programme.desc: Mustang Zibby is a “zorse“, half zebra half horse. Can she be trained and find her place in the mustang herd?

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E18 Wildlife Nannies: Wild Arc Canada
programme.desc: Wild Arc is a 24/7 animal ER taking in injured animals from all over Vancouver island - a really tough job.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E19 Wildlife Nannies: Eagles, Owls and Hawks
programme.desc: There are eagles, owls and hawks that need individual care at Fawn Wildlife Haven Rehab, Odessa.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E20 Wildlife Nannies: Baby Alarm!
programme.desc: Baby alarm at Wildpark Daun: Monkeys, emus, and a little lamb are all brought into the world.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E21 Wildlife Nannies: 25 Orphaned Opossums
programme.desc: A San Diego resident Pam Norman shares her home with her husband, her two dogs and 25 orphaned opossums.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E22 Wildlife Nannies: Grizzly Bears
programme.desc: Grizzly Bears are one of the feature attractions of Grouse Mountain Refuge for Endangered Wildlife, Vancouver.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E23 Wildlife Nannies: Best of the Babies
programme.desc: This Best Of episode is a countdown from 10 to 6 of heartwarming stories from the Wildlife Nannies.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E24 Wildlife Nannies: The Rest of the Best
programme.desc: With more than 22 episodes, Wildlife Nannies has shot over 50 stories all over the world. From Salzburg to the beautiful Florida coast, from the breathtaking Canadian wilderness to Berlin – there were many heartwarming stories. This episode is a countdown of the ten stories that touched us the most. Best Of 5 to 1!

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Wildlife Nannies: 2 Baby Raccoons
programme.desc: Two baby raccoons saved from a front yard are in need of special care at Raccoons Bush Wildlife Sanctuary.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Wildlife Nannies: Spa Day
programme.desc: A spa day of back scrubbing, massage and more for the manatees of Homosassa Springs Wildlife State Park.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Wildlife Nannies: Abandoned Fawn
programme.desc: An abandoned fawn is found in woods.and is brought to Fawn Wildlife Rescue Station with a broken leg.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Wildlife Nannies: Orphaned Seals
programme.desc: Along the rugged coast of Aquarium, Vancouver there are orphaned and injured seals that need help.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Wildlife Nannies: Bat Nanny
programme.desc: Will a bat nanny help a bat fledgling learn how to fly and be released back into the night skies?

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 Wildlife Nannies: Albino Coati Biene
programme.desc: Albino coati Biene moves to a bigger enclosure and meets her new buddies, two raccoons. Will they get along?

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 Wildlife Nannies: Marmoset Family
programme.desc: A Marmoset family reunion will take place at the Zoo Eberswalde, Germany.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 Wildlife Nannies: Little Opossum
programme.desc: A new little opossum has arrived at the SPCA Wildlife Care Center, a real paradise for Floridas opossums

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 Wildlife Nannies: Wild Boar Piglet
programme.desc: Wild boar piglet Janis is very excited to rejoin pot-bellied pigs, Schnitzel and Knodel, after an injury.

programme.title: Wildlife Nannies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E10 Wildlife Nannies: Animal Shelter; Babies
programme.desc: Clint and Irene Davy turned their home into a animals shelter when they first arrived on the Gibsons coast.

programme.title: Poppys Promise - Secret Life in a Cornfield
programme.desc: The cornfield - just an area for producing food… or a land full of secrets? This doc portrays a little recognized habitat right next door. The spectacular visuals filmed with state of the art equipment introduce the surprisingly large diversity of field inhabitants. We follow a hamster family through a season full of adventures and are drawn into an unknown world – a world of which we thought we knew everything about. In the western industrial nations cornfields and woods take up the greatest proportion of rural land. But how much natural life dwells in a cornfield? Why are some cornfield inhabitants harmful and others useful and what do the colourful flowers at the edge of the field...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for...

programme.title: Dreams of the Settlers - An American Journey
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Through Utahs Canyons to Salt Lake City
programme.desc: It’s a dream route leading from the casino metropolis of Las Vegas, to Salt Lake City, the Mormon capital. It is a journey that follows the footsteps of the first settlers: the Mormons. They came to this desert belt of the United States during the second half of the 19th century to escape persecution and in search of the promised land. Some of them founded Las Vegas. Others moved through the canyons and over the mountains of the colossal Colorado Plateau, where they found water and pasture, to establish many small settlements. The landscapes through which they trekked, had and still have, a breathtaking and bizarre majestic beauty. Bryce Canyon, the hogbacks and the Escalante Staircase...

programme.title: Dreams of the Settlers - An American Journey
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Through Louisiana Along the Mississippi
programme.desc: The vast Delta of the Mississippi River is the gateway to the South of the United States. It always has been. This is where our journey begins: through Louisiana along the banks of the mighty river, to the big inland city of New Orleans, founded long ago by the French. Further inland, sugarcane plantations and the villas of their former owners stretch as far as the eye can see. To the north, we leave the river and, taking spectacular roads, we pass through the swamplands of the Mississippi, which were once impenetrable, serving as the ideal hideout for many a runaway. Bordering Texas, where the swamplands end, is the beginning of the vast cattle country. This is home to the last remaining...

programme.title: Dreams of the Settlers - An American Journey
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Along the Shores of the Great Lakes
programme.desc: The Great Lakes are among the most mythical landscapes of North America: endless water, endless forest. Many Native American peoples lived there; later European settlers followed on the heels of the white hunters and trappers. They hunted in the forests and transported their furs and other goods across the water to the south where a small river situated at the southern tip of Lake Michigan flows onward towards the southern states. The settlement that sprung up there was called Checagou by the Indians. Much later, the settlement was to be the first skyscraper city in the world: Chicago, the megacity on the Great Lake.

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Secrets of the Mediterranean, Ep.1
programme.desc: The contours of the Mediterranean have changed during the course of its history. Near Gibraltar, Africa was once connected to the European continent. When the land bridge at Gibraltar collapsed, the Mediterranean basin filled up again. The Suez Canal is today connected to the Red Sea. This route enables animals to reach the Mediterranean, where they cause problems.

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Secrets of the Mediterranean, Ep. 2
programme.desc: Rugged rocks, blue sea and idyllic, sandy beaches - this is the Mediterranean as we know it. But this impression is deceptive: the Mediterranean is under constant change. The continents are moving towards one another. Animals, that have to survive under such extreme conditions, must find a way to escape the dangers. Between deserts and volcanoes, the challenges for the animals are enormous.

programme.title: Germanys Wild Amazon
programme.desc: As one of Germany’s beauties, the river was the gem of Germanys landscape. But with industrialization it became the country’s hardest working river and like everything that has been overworked, it lost it magnificence and charm. Due to tender love and care, the river is now a reigning example of one of the most successful and outstanding renaturation projects in the country.The film shows never before seen shots of the river now pulsing with life. We will show you the winding river bed, spawning salmon, mating crabs and still-growing anchor ice. You will see dipper birds searching for food under water, kingfishers catching fish, a family life of badgers, foxes and a wide variety of birds....

programme.title: Germanys Wild Reservoirs
programme.desc: One of the smallest dams in the Bergisches Land is the Panzertalsperre, with an area of just four-and-a-half football pitches. On the other hand, the Dhunntalsperre is the largest with the area of 660 football pitches. They all transform a stretch of flowing water into still and stagnant water. As a result, completely diverse ecosystems have developed there: where the dipper once dived for insect larvae, cormorants and gray herons now fish and swans and coots cavort. In recent summers, even greater challenges have emerged: the effects of climate change - from extreme drought to destructive floods. On a smaller scale, a rather industrious dam master is operating flood protection: The...

programme.title: Germanys Mystic Forest
programme.desc: 2.000 rivers and streams dig deep into the underground and transport their water into reservoirs or "Germanys Wild Amazon", the Wupper. These forests and rivers, together with heathlands and moors, are home to a diverse fauna. Martens, badgers, wild boars, hares, roe deer, and red deer, even black grouse and hazel deer find shelter in these parts. Wolves also have a dominant presence, not to mention those who live underground, such as lizards, bats, and snakes. Accompany us on a journey where we explore every corner of this rugged land. Climb underground into the Bergisches Land, through the vast hidden cave systems that sprawl far beneath the forests. There is also much to be discovered...

programme.title: Northern Woods
programme.desc: It is a musical film a a tributeto the Nordic forest: it shows its development from a primeval wood to a cultivated forest. Once populated by wild animals such as wolves, bears, eagles, deer and musk oxen, complex re-enactment-scenes shot by dollies and helicopters vividly depict the colonization of the forest by the Celts and Germans. But as time progressed, the northern forest has on numerous occasions fallen victim to environmental degradation and overexploitation. Several provisions were made to protect this wild beauty. The Helsinki resolution of 1993, which stipulated that the woods be used in a way and in a magnitude which guarantees their biological variety and productiveness and...

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: Switzerland, Italy: The VIA FRANCIGENA to Rome
programme.desc: For centuries, pilgrims have set off on the Via Francigena in the hopes of reaching the tombs of the apostles Peter and Paul in Rome. The ancient pilgrimage route leads through the imposing Alps to the Great St Bernard Pass and from there cross-country through Italy.

programme.title: mareTV: Wismar Bay - World Heritage and Water Paradise
programme.desc: The Wismar Bay is unique in its diversity on the Mecklenburg Baltic Sea coast: cliffs, sandy beaches, salt marshes, enchanted islands and, last but not least, the proud Hanseatic city of Wismar with its brick Gothic buildings, which are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. When the mighty logs get wedged together in the timber mill in the port of Wismar, Steven Buchholz has to get to work with his chainsaw. Its a dangerous job, because the logs weigh tons. As a trained carpenter, Steven is a virtuoso with the chain saw. Even after his shift is over, he is looking for the thrill: the wind off his home island of Poel is favorable that day and he wants to reclaim the German record in the kite...

programme.title: Africanews
programme.desc: Africanews is the only independent national and international news channel from an African perspective. It reports breaking news from the continent, delivers unbiased reporting and is available on TV and digital platforms.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation.

Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation.

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTNs brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the worlds most powerful laser and the worlds smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers

According to the investigators initial findings, the 38-year-old nurses aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Bloody Christmas next to the Leman lake (CASE OF RUTH LÉGERET) - On January 4, 2006, Ruth Legeret was found dead in the middle of a pool of blood at her luxurious property in Vevey, Switzerland. Next to her was the lifeless body of her friend, Marina Studer. Who could have killed these two simple and wealthy widows? Clue after clue, the Swiss polices investigation would revolve around an environment of family jealousy and financial greed.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: September 16 2005. The lifeless body of Audrey Jouannet, 24, is found hidden under the bed in her small apartment in Soisy-sur-Seine. It soon becomes apparent that the young woman has been tortured at length before being strangled. But surprisingly, though the highly meticulous murderer has taken care to leave no sign of his passage, the autopsy reveals traces of sperm on the victim. It will take all of the investigators intuition to pierce the mystery of this heinous crime...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Sylvain Dromard finds the body of his wife Laurence lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen. The crime was particularly violent and the theory of a burglary that went wrong is soon excluded. But investigators dont understand who could want the adorable hairdresser of Saint-Martin-dAblois dead. During the investigation, the work of profilers will enable them to draw a very precise portrait of the murderer...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: After an ordinary dinner, Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell suffer severe abdominal pains.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Nelly Cremel, 39, leaves her home to go jogging... never to return. Eight days later, after a vast search campaign, her body is found. Theres no doubt that its murder. The case soon ignites public opinion, even inflaming passions at the highest level of the state. The clues lead investigators on a number of trails, from the shadows of the French secret service to a manhunt for a possible sex maniac, in a case of murder most foul.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Willy Pomonti, a retired architect, is found savagely murdered in his opulent villa in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, near Paris. It soon becomes clear that the man has been tortured prior to death. At several points during this extraordinary enquiry, police will feel theyre holding the culprit... It will take them ten years to finally shed light on this particularly violent crime.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The lifeless body of Christophe Lejard is found by his son just metres from their home. The man was shot in the head as he was getting into his car to go to work. A veritable execution, which at first glance doesnt square with the profile of the quiet family man. Yet behind the appearances, the investigation gradually reveals all the hate and resentment that revolved around the victim.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A man walks into a gendarmerie near Saint-Malo to report that his wife has been missing since the previous day. The couple are going through a divorce, but this mother would never have left her seven children alone! An extensive search is undertaken but the woman cannot be found. What has happened to Adeline Piet? The investigation spans several years and experiences many twists.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The corpse of Priscillia Ciatti, 14, is discovered by the side of a field, a few hundred metres from her family home. The teenager has been stabbed sixty times with a knife and -an extra sordid detail - a devil mask is found next to her body. Was Priscillia the victim of a prowler? A serial killer? A maniac inspired by a horror movie? Investigators soon find that the young girl felt she was being watched, and even threatened...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning, Mathilde Croguennec, 18, attending "Teknival" in Brittany, is found at the foot of a tree with her throat cut. Investigators face the task of finding the killer from among the 43,000 participants of this huge open-air festival of electronic music, where drink and drugs are consumed in abundance. An unusual investigation that leads the police down a number of false avenues.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Arriving at her work, the secretary of a small firm in the suburbs of Geneva finds the body of Jean-Raymond Blatti, the companys new accountant. The man is lying in a pool of blood and, on his belly, the murderer has written "DIRTY RAPIST". Yet Jean-Raymond Blatti was never charged with sexual assault. Over the course of the investigation, this inscription will appear as one of the many mysteries of this case which is particularly rich in twists and turns.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 19th 2004, the naked and tied up body of a woman is recovered in the Ourcq canal in Fresnes-sur-Marne. The victim is impossible to identify.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On April 3th 2003, Chantal Ternik, a 48 year old housewife, is discovered hanged in her house of Sanary-sur-Mer, in Var.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On March 28th 2013, the burnt body of Anne Barbot, 38 years old, is discovered in a forest of Maine-et-Loire.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On May 17th 2005, a body is discovered in a forest of Sucy-en-Brie; Christophe Belle, 40 years old, a renowned pastry cook.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The disturbing missing case in Paris of a four year old.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On October 13th 1996, the body of young Angelique Dumetz, 18 years old, is recovered down a ditch in Oise forest. An important clue is found on the crime scene.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On February 23th 2017, policemen are alerted of the disapearrance of Brigitte Troadec, her husband Pascal, and their children Sebastien and Charlotte.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Mysterious Murder at the Farm (Valerie Bary Case)- On Friday, March 26, 2004, in the region of Dijon, Laurent Bary came home from his work to discover the lifeless body of his wife, Valerie, bathing in a pool of blood. According to the investigators initial findings, the 38-year-old nurses aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: The Bermondsey Horror
programme.desc: In 1849, a man suddenly disappeared in Bermondsey. The discovery that he had been brutally murdered enraptured the press and the public.

programme.title: In The Shadow Of Jack
programme.desc: At the time of Jack The Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner.

programme.title: Finding Dr. Crippen
programme.desc: Having killed his wife and buried her in the basement, Dr. Crippen believed he had escaped on a ship to Canada. But the police managed to hunt him down.

programme.title: The Brides In The Bath Killer
programme.desc: George Smith had many aliases. He needed them for his many wives who he would soon murder in order to claim the inheritance.

programme.title: Terror In The Roaring Twenties
programme.desc: Edith Thompson and Frederick Bywaters were in love. But the young couple was convicted for murdering her husband in a case that shocked society and fascinated Hitchcock.

programme.title: The Blackout Ripper
programme.desc: It was WWII and London was rocked by the Blitz from the planes flying above. But down on the streets below another terrible danger lurked in the shadows.

programme.title: In The Shadow Of Jack
programme.desc: At the time of Jack The Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner.

programme.title: Blood Pattern Analysis
programme.desc: Can investigators decipher what happened at a crime scene based on the size and shape of bloodstains left behind? What can fluid dynamics tell us about the technique?

programme.title: Bite Mark Analysis
programme.desc: Bitemark Analysis appeared to fit neatly in the respected field of forensic dentistry until two researchers performed a bitemark study on cadavers.

programme.title: Firearm Examination
programme.desc: Firearms Analysis is one of the most relied upon forensic science methods in the US, but its foundational validity and reliability are now facing serious questions.

programme.title: Shaken Baby Syndrome
programme.desc: Shaken Baby Syndrome is a household name, but shockingly it may not be a valid diagnosis at all. New biomechanical research has changed the conversation.

programme.title: Footwear Analysis
programme.desc: Shoe prints seem like the most classic, helpful piece of evidence at a crime scene. But how does the science behind this comparison technique hold up?

programme.title: Arson Investigation
programme.desc: In just one generation Arson investigation changed from myth-based to a science-based discipline. What is the future for those still wrongly behind bars?

programme.title: Arson Investigation
programme.desc: In just one generation Arson investigation changed from myth-based to a science-based discipline. What is the future for those still wrongly behind bars?

programme.title: Science on Fire
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they kindle our curiosity about the science behind fire. This week’s experiments investigate how you can burn metal using only a 9 volt battery, what fire can teach us about calories, and why a little bit of sodium can cause a gigantic explosion.

programme.title: Invisible Impacts
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they shine a light on the unseen science behind our everyday lives. This week’s experiments explore the resonant frequencies of bridges and human bodies.

programme.title: Water, Water Everywhere
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they dive deep into the wonderful world of water. In this week’s experiments we discover how water can start a fire, transform breakfast cereal into a magnetic field detector, and even change the way you visualize the world around you.

programme.title: Magnificent Mixtures
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they amalgamate in the name of science. In this week’s experiments we mix up some fireworks made from tin foil, whip up a stinky polymer, and try out an alchemy staple - turning lead into gold.

programme.title: Up and Atom
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they break open the atomic bonds that connect our world. This week’s experiments blow open the science behind creating a glowing pickle, how forensic teams extract DNA, and how acids can transform simple household items to their core.

programme.title: Hot Hot Heat
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they turn up the thermostat and discover the role heat plays in science. This week’s experiments investigate how to send secret messages with heat.

programme.title: Explosive Elements
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests discover the unstable world of elemental gasses. This week’s experiments include recreating a big bang with lithium, the incendiary power of methane, and how a little bit of liquified nitrogen can lend a lot of power to a rocket.

programme.title: Colorful Conundrums
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they taste the scientific rainbow. This week’s experiments highlight how electricity can tint titanium, how you can create a color wheel by lighting things on fire, and why the world gets all its colors from white light.

programme.title: Dont Believe Your Eyes
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they make science look like sorcery. This week’s experiments delve into the possibilities of mind control, why objects and people tend to sync together, and the magical mysteries behind magnesium.

programme.title: The Sound of Science
programme.desc: Join host Nick Uhas and his guests as they tune into the science behind sound. This week’s experiments hit high notes as we discover the physics of theremins, investigate how the outer ear impacts human hearing, and put on a laser show with cymatics.

programme.title: Transcontinental Railroad
programme.desc: The Americans who settled the west, those icons of freedom and independence, lived at the mercy of the railroad tycoons.

programme.title: Cold War
programme.desc: The Cold War was won not by weapons of war, but blue jeans, silk stockings, and fast food. Just follow the money.

programme.title: Civil War
programme.desc: Why, as a teenager in New Jersey in the 1980s, was Peter Sagal taught the Southern myth of the Civil War? Slaves = money = power.

programme.title: Watergate
programme.desc: Like a burger and fries, Nixon and scandal have always gone together. But why did his men break into the Watergate office building? Why did Nixon crave personal wealth?

programme.title: John Doy and the Immortal 10
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: John Doy is arrested along the Underground Railroad, but his friends are determined to set him free.

programme.title: Breaking out of Libby Prison
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: A band of POWs held in the Confederate capital attempt the Civil War’s largest prison escape.

programme.title: Pauline Cushman: Tales of a Yankee Spy
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: When actress and Union spy Pauline Cushman is captured, her performance skills offer her a way out.

programme.title: Rebel Raid in Vermont
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Confederate raiders attack a small town in Vermont. A local posse tries to cut off their escape.

programme.title: Robert Smalls: Steamboat to Freedom
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Robert Smalls is enslaved, but he has the skills and the nerve to sail a rebel ship to freedom.

programme.title: Into the Rebel Swamp
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Wallace Turnage was born a slave. He made multiple escape attempts. But on his sixth - and final - attempt, he endured a genuine odyssey.

programme.title: Merging Man and Machine
programme.desc: Why fear the rise of the machines, when we can merge and rise along with them?

programme.title: The Suppressed Science Of Psychedelics
programme.desc: Join Athena as she explores the underground world of psychedelic science, and the revolutionary impact it is poised to have on the pharmaceutical industries.

programme.title: Race: Science, Social Construct, or Both?
programme.desc: The concept of race was invented during colonial and imperialist eras as a means to reify political power structures.

programme.title: Weather Control: The Debate Over Geo-Engineering
programme.desc: In this episode, Athena takes on the controversial topic of Geoengineering, and meets scientists working on an ambitious plan to put a shield around the planet.

programme.title: Human Enhancement
programme.desc: From a cutting-edge, science-based gym and spa, to a medical clinic that offers direct ultrasound brain stimulation designed to increase mental performance.

programme.title: Genetic Editing
programme.desc: The discovery of CRISPR Cas-9 in 2012 opened up seemingly limitless potential in the field of genetic editing.

programme.title: Alternative Energy Sources
programme.desc: In this installment, Athena decodes some of the difficulties faced by the scientists and environmentalists looking to fundamentally change our relationship with energy.

programme.title: Theories Of Everything
programme.desc: Over the centuries, scientific theories have emerged that rival religious cosmology in terms of ambition and scope. But can science ever truly explain everything?

programme.title: Winged Creatures
programme.desc: Tavallinen paiva tavallisessa ravintolassa Los Angelesissa. Rauha rikkoutuu silmanrapayksessa, kun psykopaatti astelee sisaan ravintolaan, ottaa aseen esiin ja alkaa ampua eparoimatta ympariinsa. Osa ihmisista kuolee. Henkiinjaaneet yrittavat ymmartaa mita on tapahtunut, ja miten elamalle saa taas uuden merkityksen ja turvallisuuden tunteen.

programme.title: Camp X-Ray
programme.desc: Camp X-Ray kertoo nuoresta naisesta, joka liittyy Yhdysvaltain armeijaan ollakseen osa jotain itseaan ja pikkukaupunkinsa juuria suurempaa. Han paatyy kuitenkin vartijaksi Guantanamo Bayhin, missa han solmii ystavyyssuhteen yhden vangin kanssa. Eettisia kysymyksia pohtiessaan naiden kahden eri lahtokohdista tulleen ihmisen ystavyys muuttaa heidan molempien elaman.

programme.title: Ohjelmat jatkuvat pian
programme.desc: Olemme pienilla kauneusunilla! Katso lisaa Rakuten TV:n tarjoamaa ilmaisviihdetta.

programme.title: The Rum Diary
programme.desc: Hunter S. Thompsonin Rommipaivakirja-romaaniin pohjautuva elokuva seuraa kiertolaiselamaa viettavan reportteri Paul Kempin (Johnny Depp) viinanhuuruista matkaa halki Puerto Ricon pittoreskin saaren. Han on pian omaksunut paikallisvaeston rommiinhukuttautuvan elamantavan, ja tavattuaan hamarabisneksiin sekaantuneen amerikkalaisliikemiehen, Sandersonin (Aaron Eckhart), Paul on myos korviaan myoten retkussa miehen huumaavan kuumaan kihlattuun, Chenaultiin (Amber Heard).

programme.title: Auggie
programme.desc: Felix Greystonen elakeikaan olisi viela tovi, mutta firma painostaa Felixin aikaistetulle elakkeelle. Laksiaislahjaksi han saa alylasit, jotka herattavat kayttajan suurimmat haaveet eloon. Kun Felixin vaimon ura on nousukiidossa ja tytar itsenaistymassa, mies huomaa tuntevansa itsensa kovin yksinaiseksi. Paetakseen piinaavaa yksinaisyytta Felix ajautuu yha syvemmalle alylasiensa maailmaan, joka hiertaa entisestaan Felixin suhdetta etaantyneeseen perheeseensa.

programme.title: Evil Stepmom
programme.desc: Kun kaksoset haluavat auttaa isaansa deittailemaan uudelleen, he luovat hanelle profiilin deittisivustolle. Vastauksen saaminen ei kesta kauan. Toinen kaksostytoista ystavystyy uuden naisystavan tyttaren kanssa, mutta han tajuaa pian, ettei kaikki ole kohdallaan. Mutta miten han saa vasta rakastuneen isansa huomaamaan asian vakavuuden?

programme.title: In Tranzit
programme.desc: Toisen maailmansodan paatyttya joukko saksalaisia sotavankeja lahetetaan leningradilaiselle vankileirille. Leirin naistyontekijat vihaavat heidan miehensa ja poikansa tappaneita saksalaisia yli kaiken ja valmistautuvat nyt kostoon.

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Hayden Christensen nayttelee tassa kriitikoiden ylistamassa tarinassa hapaistysta toimittajasta, jonka on ohjannut ja kirjoittanut Billy Ray, CAPTAIN PHILLIPSISTÄ Oscar-ehdokkuuden saanut kirjoittaja. Kun kuuluisa toimittaja Stephen Glass (Christensen) joutuuu Forbes.com toimittajan (Steve Zahn) tutkinnan alle, paljastuu etta Glass on keksinyt monet hanen tunnetuimmista tarinoista, joka johtaa hanen tuhoonsa tassa mukaansatempaavassa, tositarinassa.

programme.title: Teen Spirit
programme.desc: Rikkinaisessa perheessa kasvanut 17-vuotias Violet (Fanning) unelmoi pop-tahteydesta ja paosta pienesta englantilaisesta kotikylastaan. Toivoa hanelle tuo kansallinen laulukilpailu Teen Spirit ja epatavallinen mentori, joka opettaa hanta laulamaan sydamestaan. Tie menestykseen on kuitenkin taynna vaaroja ja houkutuksia. Violetin on voitettava epavarmuutensa uskaltaakseen olla oma itsensa ja paastakseen lopulta loistamaan.

programme.title: Paluu Yorkshireen
programme.desc: Arthur Morrison (Jim Broadbent) saa tietaa, etta hanella on syopa ja vain muutama viikko aikaa elaa. Hanen vanhin poikansa Blake (Oscar-voittaja* Colin Firth) muuttaa Yorkshireen aitinsa luokse, kylaan jossa han syntyi. Kun Arthurin tila heikkenee, Blake puntaroi suhdettaan isaansa. Han muistaa yhteiset hetket, heidan laheisyytensa ja heidan erimielisyytensa. Kun isa kuolee, Blake alkaa muistella heidan valista sidetta – ristiriitoja, turhautumisia, rakkautta ja menetyksia, jotka kaikki kuuluvat monimutkaiseen suhteeseen isan ja pojan valilla.

programme.title: Equals
programme.desc: Utopistisessa maailmassa, missa vakivalta ja rikollisuus on kitketty poistamalla ihmisten tunteet geneettisesti, eletaan Nian ja Silasin tavoin rauhallista ja yksitoikkoista elamaa. Tyopaikallaan tiedotusmateriaalien tuotantolaitoksessa he vaihtavat tyotoverien kesken ainoastaan kohteliaisuuksia. Elama on yksinkertaista kunnes huhu tartunnasta, jonka seurauksena ihminen nayttaa tunteensa, leviaa. Sairastuneet lahetetaan pois, eika heita nahda enaa koskaan. Silas epailee kantavansa tartuntaa, ja asian vahvistuttua hanesta tulee hylkio. Silti han tuntee vetoa Niaan, joka on myos saanut tartunnan, mutta onnistuu salaamaan oireensa.

programme.title: Fast Girls
programme.desc: Kun teravakielinen katujen kasvatti Shania (Lenora Crichlow) kohtaa kunnianhimoisen, keskiluokkaisen Lisan (Lily James), heidan erilaiset maailmansa tormaavat pikajuoksuradalla lahes tuhoisin seurauksin. Elokuvan “FAST GIRLS” paahenkiloiden haaveena on edustaa maataan yleisurheilun MM-kisoissa. Matka sinne on dramaattinen, raastava ja inspiroiva.

programme.title: The Room
programme.desc: Kiireisen suurkaupunkielaman vaatimuksiin kyllastyneet Kate ja Matt muuttavat unelmataloonsa maalla. Mutta vanhassa talossa on salaisuutensa, ja pian he loytavat tarkoin katketyn huoneen. Huone, jolla on se upea ominaisuus, etta se pystyy tuomaan esiin ja materialisoimaan kaiken, minka he toivovat. Mutta mikaan onnihan ei ole taydellinen ilman kohtalokkaita seurauksia: huoneeseen ilmestynyt ei voi lahtea huoneesta kuihtumatta pois. Ja Kate ja Matt toivovat kaikkein eniten… lasta.

programme.title: 30:e november
programme.desc: Adam kavereineen kayttaa aikaansa vihaamiensa maahanmuuttajien hairikointiin. Sitten Adam tapaa perulaisen Julian ja he salamarakastuvat. He tapaavat salassa, koska Adamin kaverit tai Julian perhe eivat hyvaksyisi suhdetta. Ruotsin kansallispaivana Adam kavereineen kohtaavat Julian veli Saschan ystavineen. Kohtaaminen johtaa kahden kuolemaan.

programme.title: Bekas
programme.desc: 1990-luvun alussa, Saddam Husseinin hallinto painostaa Irakin kurdialuetta. Kaksi koditonta kurdipoikaanakee Terasmiehen kaupungin ensimmaisessa elokuvateatterissa ja paattaa lahtea Amerikkaan.Paastaakseen sinne he tarvitsevat passit, rahaa ja paljon onnea. Vaikka heilla ei ole mitaan naista, healoittavat silti matkan, joka vie heita kohti unelmaa Amerikasta.Elokuva on Karzan Kaderin esikoisohjaus ja kahden veljeksen rooleissa nahdaan Sarwar Fazil ja Zamand Taha.

programme.title: Chosen
programme.desc: Vuonna 1944, tuhansittain Ita-Euroopan juutalaisia kuolee joukkoteurastuksissa. Vaimonsa kuoleman jalkeen toimimaan havahtunut unkarilainen asianajaja Sonson paatyy johtamaan vastarintaliikkeen aatteellista taistelua kasvavan epatoivon vallassa toimivaa, vaarallista natsiarmeijaa vastaan. Yhdistamalla uskalluksen ja uhkarohkeuden hapeilemattomyyteen, Sonson kaantaa silkan selviytymistaistelun joksikin paljon merkittavammaksi – keinoksi kostaa omiensa kuolema pelastamalla tuhansia muita.

programme.title: Ohjelmat jatkuvat pian
programme.desc: Olemme pienilla kauneusunilla! Katso lisaa Rakuten TV:n tarjoamaa ilmaisviihdetta.

programme.title: Journeyman
programme.desc: Puolustettuaan titteliaan rankassa ottelussa, nyrkkeilyn keskisarjan maailmanmestari Matty Burton romahtaa. Matka kohti puhe-, liikunta- ja muistikyvyn palautumista tulee olemaan rankin hanen otteluistaan, mutta palkinto on tyon arvoista, kun hanen suhteensa vaimo Emmaan ja tytar Miaan on pelissa.

programme.title: Griffin and Phoenix
programme.desc: Kun Griffin saa kuulla, etta hanella on kuolemaan johtava sairaus, han paattaa ottaa kohtalonsa omiin kasiinsa ja elaa taysilla loppuun asti. Han tapaa Phoenixin ja aikaa myoten rakastuu tahan, mutta myos Phoenixilla on salaisuus...

programme.title: Paluu Yorkshireen
programme.desc: Arthur Morrison (Jim Broadbent) saa tietaa, etta hanella on syopa ja vain muutama viikko aikaa elaa. Hanen vanhin poikansa Blake (Oscar-voittaja* Colin Firth) muuttaa Yorkshireen aitinsa luokse, kylaan jossa han syntyi. Kun Arthurin tila heikkenee, Blake puntaroi suhdettaan isaansa. Han muistaa yhteiset hetket, heidan laheisyytensa ja heidan erimielisyytensa. Kun isa kuolee, Blake alkaa muistella heidan valista sidetta – ristiriitoja, turhautumisia, rakkautta ja menetyksia, jotka kaikki kuuluvat monimutkaiseen suhteeseen isan ja pojan valilla.

programme.title: The Shamrock Spitfire
programme.desc: Tositarina irlantilaisesta havittajalentaja Brendan ”Paddy” Finucanesta, josta vain 21-vuotiaana tuli Royal Air Forcen nuorin laivueenkomentaja ja yksi toisen maailmansodan suurimmista ja palkituimmista havittaja-assista.

programme.title: Evil Stepmom
programme.desc: Kun kaksoset haluavat auttaa isaansa deittailemaan uudelleen, he luovat hanelle profiilin deittisivustolle. Vastauksen saaminen ei kesta kauan. Toinen kaksostytoista ystavystyy uuden naisystavan tyttaren kanssa, mutta han tajuaa pian, ettei kaikki ole kohdallaan. Mutta miten han saa vasta rakastuneen isansa huomaamaan asian vakavuuden?

programme.title: Sokkeloita ja hirvioita
programme.desc: Robbiella ja hanen yliopistokavereillaan on pakkomielle roolipelista ’Sokkeloita ja hirvioita’. Mutta peli saa oudon kaanteen, kun Robbie alkaa kokea nakyja heidan pelattuaan paikallisen mystisen maamerkin luona.

programme.title: Promised Land
programme.desc: Intensiivisessa draamassa seurataan kahta high school -opiskelijaa, Hancockia ja Dannya, heidan valmistumisensa jalkeen. Hancock tyytyy cheerleader-tyttoystavansa kanssa keskiluokkaiseen keskinkertaisuuteen ja etaantyy Dannysta ja taman psykoottisesta vaimosta, Bevista.

programme.title: Synchronicity
programme.desc: "Fyysikko Jim Beale on keksinyt aikakoneen, joka mullistaa maailman. Kun vaikutusvaltainen pohatta Klaus Meisner kuulee keksinnosta, han paattaa omia koneen hinnalla milla hyvansa. Jotta keksinto ei joutuisi vaariin kasiin, Jim paattaa matkustaa ajassa taaksepain muuttaakseen asioita. Sundancen elokuvajuhlien lempilapsen Jacob Gentryn elokuva, Synchronicity, on aivonystyroita kutkuttava ‘Scifi Noir’, joka kulkee Blade Runnerin, Gattacan ja Mementon jalanjaljissa."

programme.title: Gringa
programme.desc: Ongelmia kokenut teinitytto lahtee Meksikoon etsimaan isaansa, jota han ei edes tunne. He opettelevat yhdessa olemaan perhe, vaikka ensin heita yhdistavat vain menetykset.

programme.title: Before Dawn
programme.desc: Nuori mies jattaa perheensa lammastilan taakseen Australian takamailla ja liittyy maanmiestensa joukkoon lansirintamalle ensimmaiseen maailmansotaan. Heidan tavoitteenaan on nopeuttaa verisen konfliktin paattymista. Mutta sodan raivotessa miehen taytyy selvita juoksuhautojen ankarassa todellisuudessa ja taistelun valittomassa vaarassa pysyakseen hengissa – ja jattamatta ketaan taakseen.

programme.title: Winged Creatures
programme.desc: Tavallinen paiva tavallisessa ravintolassa Los Angelesissa. Rauha rikkoutuu silmanrapayksessa, kun psykopaatti astelee sisaan ravintolaan, ottaa aseen esiin ja alkaa ampua eparoimatta ympariinsa. Osa ihmisista kuolee. Henkiinjaaneet yrittavat ymmartaa mita on tapahtunut, ja miten elamalle saa taas uuden merkityksen ja turvallisuuden tunteen.

programme.title: Undergods
programme.desc: Mustalla huumorilla viimeistelty scifidystopia maailmasta, jossa vain harva on selvinnyt ja selviytyjistakin jokainen on omalla tavallaan vahan rikki. Kafkamainen miljoo yhdistettyna 2020-luvun romahtaneisiin unelmiin saa jo itsessaan katsojan ihon kananlihalle. Elokuva alkaa, kun kaksi ruumiinkeraajaa kiertelee pitkin autioituneita katuja ja kertoilee tyonsa lomassa romuttuneista haaveistaan, jotka ajoivat heidat tahan kolkkoon nykyhetkeen.

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: Kolme miesta saapuu autiolle saarelle Skotlannin edustalla vartioimaan majakkaa. Eraana paivana vedenrajasta loytyy tiedoton mies vieressaan suuri arkullinen kultaa.., Tasta seuraa vainoharhoista, eristyksesta ja ahneudesta syntyva eloonjaamistaistelu. Gerard Butler (300, Angel Has Fallen) loistaa roolissaan rehellisena perheenisana, jonka mystiset olosuhteet pakottavat aarirajoilleen. Elokuvan on ohjannut tanskalainen Kristoffer Nyholm (Taboo, Rikos) ja myos tanskalainen Søren Malling (Pinnan alla, Sota) nahdaan ratkaisevassa sivuroolissa. Elokuva pohjaa tositapahtumiin.

programme.desc: Willie and Alan agree to help Miss Kay open her own bakery.

programme.title: Van Hellsing
programme.desc: Missy and Jases son Reed purchases an old van to boost his music career.

programme.title: Toad to Perdition
programme.desc: Willie and his brothers spend too much time frog hunting.

programme.title: RV There Yet?
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a road trip to Liberty University.

programme.title: Willie and Kories Anniversorry
programme.desc: The Robertson family throws a party for Willie and Kories 25th anniversary.

programme.title: Statue of Imitations
programme.desc: When Willie asks a local chainsaw artist to make him a statue, he gets a big surprise when its revealed that the statue is of an unlikely subject -- Willie himself.

programme.title: A Decent Proposal
programme.desc: On a trip to New York, Jases son Reed proposes to his girlfriend.

programme.title: Father Knows Pest

programme.title: Children of the Cornbread
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off.

programme.title: Whole Lotta Bull
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn.

programme.title: Here Comes the Son

programme.title: Brod Trip
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product.

programme.title: Techs and Balances

programme.title: Razing the Snakes

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of a junkyard business. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victims wife, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Janet Overton died suspiciously in 1988, and the investigation hit a dead end when the autopsy indicated no foul play was involved. A telephone tip and the sensitive nose of a forensic examiner indicated otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of a murdered horse rancher explains that the last time she saw her husband was when he was leaving the house to go jogging. Police become suspicious when forensic evidence eventually leads investigators back to the ranch.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Almost 20 years later, an old hat brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body. Finally, investigators use a single tooth found among some charred remains to identify her.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with another car.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder - that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder investigation in Florida crosses jurisdictions from New York and Jamaica. The police rely on cell phone mapping, wiretapping and a host of forensic evidence to link a suspect to a murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the groups lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A three-year-old develops a respiratory condition. His father has Alzheimers. An investigator reveals that their ill health is due to mold in their modern home.

programme.desc: When police discovered the body of Douglas Beamishs estranged wife, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamishs parents. It was the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case.

programme.desc: In 1984, California firefighters battled ten arson fires in three weeks. When cigarettes and a scrap of paper connected the case to similar fires further north, the hunt was on for a dangerous pyromaniac.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A beautiful young woman falls to her death from a cliff overlooking the ocean. Initially, investigators think it was a tragic accident. But after a forensic examination, police uncover a very different picture of what happened.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who killed his wife. Forensic evidence disproves that story later on.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher gives his friend a ride home but never returns; his wife and friend receive letters saying he started a new life, but they suspect foul play despite no body being discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who let his victim write a last will and informed the family of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads dont pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if shed been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man is found dead in his home, and his ex-wife has a perfect alibi. To determine time of death, investigators need to know when the victim ate his last meal.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide - but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who suffered from mental illness is found dead. Was it due to natural causes, suicide or murder?

programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed shed been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Chris Ochoa confessed to the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. Can DNA evidence identify the real perpetrator?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a talented television news anchor is shot to death outside her home, it appears to be a crime of passion perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Prompted by news of a flight attendants brutal murder, the son of a previous victim contacts police.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasnt an accident, it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sinks when a fast-moving, violent storm strikes the Louisiana coast. The captain drowns, but the deckhand is rescued fourteen hours later. The crewman is hailed as a hero - until the captains body is discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanished after attending a party. The prime suspect had two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome circumstantial evidence, but forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A beautiful young woman falls to her death from a cliff overlooking the ocean. Initially, investigators think it was a tragic accident. But after a forensic examination, police uncover a very different picture of what happened.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of a millionaire indicated robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a residential community saw anything the day one of their neighbors was brutally murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two people witness a truck driving over an unconscious man and flee into a nearby bar, but when the police turn up, the truck, the man and the witnesses are gone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer finds a womans body while on routine patrol of a public park. During the autopsy, the medical examiner preserves the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappeared along a California highway in 1991. Three years later, the case was solved when a mans refrigerated truck was looked upon with suspicion.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of a murdered horse rancher explains that the last time she saw her husband was when he was leaving the house to go jogging. Police become suspicious when forensic evidence eventually leads investigators back to the ranch.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are led on a wild goose chase when the wife of a prominent banker is kidnapped. An entomologists unexpected discovery leads to a new suspect - and the realization that ordinary office equipment can leave extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a "cold case squad" learned that the womans ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victims husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fire erupted in Kings Cross Station, killing 31 people and injuring dozens more. Investigators pinpointed the cause of the fire with state-of-the-art technology.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is shot to death in her store just one day before she is to testify against the man accused of robbing her. The robber becomes the prime suspect, but he has a solid alibi.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appears to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into 48-year-old Martha Hansens murder is helped by a legal requirement that bars have video cameras installed on the premises.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Janet Overton died suspiciously in 1988, and the investigation hit a dead end when the autopsy indicated no foul play was involved. A telephone tip and the sensitive nose of a forensic examiner indicated otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott, police use a garbage bag to connect a suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, the founder of American Atheists disappeared with one of her sons, her granddaughter and $500,000 in gold coins. The police investigated several suspects, including David R. Waters, who worked for American Atheists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she has no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume its a hunting accident - until they find a strange letter, allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who killed his wife. Forensic evidence disproves that story later on.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The only clue recovered from a shooting is a twelve-guage shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon to trace it to its owner

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a trio of unsolved murders occurred in Wichita Falls, Texas. Later, a fourth murder from the same time period provided the police with far more than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isnt usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a mans murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man is found dead in his home, and his ex-wife has a perfect alibi. To determine time of death, investigators need to know when the victim ate his last meal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who let his victim write a last will and informed the family of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads dont pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Almost 20 years later, an old hat brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A three-year-old develops a respiratory condition. His father has Alzheimers. An investigator reveals that their ill health is due to mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two vanishes after a shopping trip. Her body is discovered a month later. Witnesses say they saw the victim being forced into a car by an unknown person.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if shed been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods.

programme.title: Monster Carp

programme.title: Monster Carp

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: Carp fishing definitely isnt something that you would immediately associate with a country that is better known for its stunning beaches, fragrant food and full moon parties.

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: Every year thousands of British carp anglers travel across the English Channel with their mates to partake in a carp fishing holiday.

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: The Balkans have made a remarkable recovery considering how recently they were a war-torn part of the world, and now attract large numbers of tourists each year.

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: The Extremadura region was where the Romans first introduced carp to Spain, and this rugged area now has a reputation for producing some massive ones from the huge lakes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Great British Menu 2012 enters its final week. In todays programme the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the Great British Menu judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winners have been announced and this final programme follows the successful chefs in the run up to the banquet, as they make the painstaking preparations, for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The spotlight is on Scotland. Returning contenders Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Mark Greenaway are all determined to get one of their dishes to the banquet at the Royal Albert Hall to celebrate 25 years of Comic Reliefs Red Nose Day.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The competition continues as returning contenders Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Mark Greenaway cook their fish dishes. Will a traditional Scottish soup, or a chowder or a risky no cook mackerel dish impress veteran judge Angela Hartnett MBE?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The competition heats up as the three returning Scottish contenders Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Mark Greenaway cook their main courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish returning contenders Michael Smith, Tony Sigh and Mark Greenaway have just one more chance to impress veteran judge Angela Hartnett MBE and win their place in front of the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its decision time on Great British Menu Does Comic Relief for the chefs from Scotland. One chef left the competition and only two remain, who will cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the turn of three chefs from the North West. Returning contender Aiden Byrne is determined to go all the way. Hes up against two fiercely competitive newcomers Mary-Ellen McTague and Chris Holland both of whom are determined to make their mark.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from the North West cook their fish courses. Will Aiden Byrnes The Culinary Joke - a take on a classic prawn cocktail raise a laugh? Or will Mary-Ellen McTagues dish of Dover sole or Chris Hollands Gone Fishing salmon dish prove winners?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their main course. Will Aiden Byrnes witty beef dish entitled Long Horn Beef With Noodle Pot prove a winner? Or will Mary-Ellen McTagues goat dish called Our Kid or Chris Hollands dish called A Tasting of Pork score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the North Wests chefs last chance to impress before the final two chefs are chosen to face the Great British Menu judging panel. Which dessert will help get two chefs through?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its decision time on Great British Menu Does Comic Relief for the chefs from the North West. One chef left the competition and only two remain, who will cook their entire menus for the judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the curtain raiser as the Central chefs go all out. Three culinary heavyweights return, two Michelin star chef Daniel Clifford, Michelin star Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland who has beaten them both before in the Great British Menu kitchen.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish courses. Daniel Clifford puts up a creative dish called Catch of the Day. Richard Bainbridges dish is titled Tongue in Cheek. And Will Hollands dish - Coconut poached brill, crab, celeriac and tomato essence.

programme.desc: The chefs from the Central region cook their main courses. And veteran Marcus Wareing is looking for perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today nerves play a huge part as all three chefs from the South West, fresh to the competition, get to grips with their new environment. Chris Eden, Peter Sanchez-Iglesias and Emily Watkins cook their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In todays programme the South West chefs cook their fish courses. Cornishman Chris Eden takes inspiration from home to create a lobster and oyster dish called Gone Surfing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the chefs from Wales raise the curtain with their starters, but which one is going to produce a showstopper? Returning contender Michelin star chef Richard Davies, experienced Mary Ann Gilchrist or young gun 19 year old Luke Thomas?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In todays programme the chefs cook their fish course: Richard Davies serves up Grilled and tartare of mackerel, while Mary Ann Gilchrist serves a lobster dish. Luke Thomas takes on a classic fish finger called Haddock smoky and lobster fish finger.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today sees the chefs from Wales prepare their main course, but will any of them impress veteran Jeremy Lee enough to give them a top score?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the final chance for the chefs to impress Jeremy Lee with their dessert dishes. Which creation will help get two chefs through to the judging show?
